intro: Bufonia kotschyana, commonly known as the Kotschy's bufonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features a stout, hairy stem that bears several alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Bufonia kotschyana is characterized by its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
